API.ADK

Class Driver.CANDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • API.ADK.Driver.CANDevice
  • Enclosing class:
    Driver

    public class Driver.CANDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    Subclass CANDevice. All command supported by the CANblue are included here.
    Author:
    hroesdiyono
    See Also:
    API_ADK.Device

      The receive thread for receiving all Bluetooth data.

      The transmit thread for transmitting bulk CAN message.

      • respBuffer

        private volatile ResponseBuffer respBuffer
        A response buffer for each Device / Bluetooth connection.

      • versionNeeded

        private boolean versionNeeded
        Version information flag. The version information is sent by the device if the version command is sent, which is needed, or at the beginning of Bluetooth communication if the autostart flag is on, which is not needed and should be ignored.

      • intCANMessage

        private Driver.CANDevice.CANMessage[] intCANMessage
        A Driver.CANDevice.CANMessage array, for internal use. This array is used in the filtering process. Currently, there is only one controller for each device, so the CANMessage array is only one dimensional.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver.CANDevice

        private Driver.CANDevice(byte inputListIndex)
        Private constructor, can only be called from inside the class. It initializes internal variables and objects. When used with API_ADK, it is created automatically at the creation of API_ADK.Device object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of Driver.intDeviceList value.

    • Method Detail

      • connectDevice

        public ReturnCode connectDevice()
        Initialize the object, open a connection to the device, and start the internal threads.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MAC_ID, ReturnCode.UNKNOWN_DEVICE, ReturnCode.FAIL_GETTING_REMOTE_DEVICE, ReturnCode.FAIL_CREATING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_CLOSING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_INPUTSTREAM, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_OUTPUTSTREAM, or ReturnCode.FAIL_STARTING_RECEIVE_THREAD.

      • disconnectDevice

        public ReturnCode disconnectDevice()
        Check whether all Driver.CANDevice.CANController and Driver.CANDevice.CANMessage objects have been deinitialized, close a connection to the device, and stop the internal threads.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.CONTROLLER_INSTANCE_STILL_CONNECTED, ReturnCode.MESSAGE_CHANNEL_STILL_OPEN, or ReturnCode.FAIL_CLOSING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET.

      • readDeviceVersion

        public ReturnCode readDeviceVersion(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Read the Firmware version of the Device.
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • readDeviceProtocol

        public ReturnCode readDeviceProtocol(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Read the protocol version of the Device.
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • readHardwareNumber

        public ReturnCode readHardwareNumber(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Read the hardware number of the Device.
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:

      • readErrorStatus

        public ReturnCode readErrorStatus(ErrorBuffer flag)
        Read the status of the CAN Controller and the status of the internal transmit and receive thread. Eventhough the return code is not success, the thread status are valid. If the threads are not running, try to connect to the device again. param flag Output: The status of the controller and threads. return ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • writeStringToBluetooth

        private ReturnCode writeStringToBluetooth(java.lang.String data)
        Put data to Bluetooth output stream and a '\n' is automatically added. This method is used to transmit command.
        Parameters:
        data - Input: String of command.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, or ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH.

      • writeArrayToBluetooth

        private ReturnCode writeArrayToBluetooth(byte[] data,
                               int length)
        Put data to Bluetooth output stream and a '\n' is automatically added. The maximum length of the message is 50. This method is used to transmit a message.
        Parameters:
        data - Input: An array of message.
        length - Input: The length of the message array.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.MESSAGE_TOO_LONG, or ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH.

      • sendAndReceiveCommand

        private ReturnCode sendAndReceiveCommand(java.lang.String data,
                               int waitForResponse)
        Send a command and wait for a response. In case of multiple line responses, more waiting time is handled by each calling methods.
        Parameters:
        data - Input: String of command (without a '\n').
        waitForResponse - Input: Maximum time needed to wait for the response (in 100ms unit).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • applyFilteringMessage

        private void applyFilteringMessage(MessageStructure inputMessage)
        Filter the received message and put it into the receive buffer of each message channel.
        Parameters:
        inputMessage - Input: Message to be filtered.

      • HexASCIIArrayToInt

        private int HexASCIIArrayToInt(byte[] inputArray,
                     int startIndex,
                     int inputLength)
        This method should only be used internally for converting the value of MessageID and Data[] with the maximum possible value of 0x1FFF FFFF or 8 characters. For example: 7, F, F to 0x7FF.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - Input: An ASCII array.
        startIndex - Input: Start index of the array.
        inputLength - Input: Length of the data.
        Returns:
        The value of the conversion result or -1 for unsupported value.

      • intToHexASCIIArray

        private byte[] intToHexASCIIArray(int inputValue)
        This method should only be used internally for converting an integer (message ID or data) to an ASCII array, with the maximum input of 0x20000000. For example: 0x12 to '1' and '2'.
        Parameters:
        inputValue - Input: An integer value.
        Returns:
        An array of Hex ASCII or null if it is out of range.

      • ASCIIArrayToString

        private java.lang.String ASCIIArrayToString(byte[] inputArray,
                                  int startIndex,
                                  int inputLength)
        This method should only be used internally for converting an ASCII array to a String. For example: '1' and '2' to "12".
        Parameters:
        inputArray - Input: An ASCII array.
        startIndex - Input: Start index of the array.
        inputLength - Input: Length of the data.
        Returns:
        A string or null if the conversion fails.

        private java.lang.Object resizeArray(java.lang.Object oldArray,
                           int newSize)
        Resize an array object, including int or String.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - Input: The old object array.
        newSize - Input: The new array size.
        Returns:
        The new object array.

      • readCANblueVersion

        public ReturnCode readCANblueVersion(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Read the Firmware version of the CANblue device. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • readCANblueHardwareNumber

        public ReturnCode readCANblueHardwareNumber(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Read the hardware number of the CANblue device. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly. Only work for CANblue II, CANblue only returns "I OK: IDENTIFY". So the hardware number for CANblue is "IDENTIFY".
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.FAIL_PARSING_HARDWARE_NUMBER, ReturnCode.UNKNOWN_DEVICE, ReturnCode.NO_VALID_HARDWARE_NUMBER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • readCANblueConfiguration

        public ReturnCode readCANblueConfiguration(CANblueConfiguration config)
        Read the configuration of the CANblue. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        config - Output: The configuration of the CANblue device.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • setCANblueAutostart

        public ReturnCode setCANblueAutostart(boolean autostart)
        Change the Autostart mode on and off. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        autostart - Input: True for on or false for off.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • setCANblueDefaultSetting

        public ReturnCode setCANblueDefaultSetting()
        Use the default setting of the CANblue configuration. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • resetCANblueController

        public ReturnCode resetCANblueController()
        Reset the CAN controller of the CANblue. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • addCANblueMACList

        public ReturnCode addCANblueMACList(java.lang.String MAC_ID)
        Add a MAC address to the MAC list for the bridge mode. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        MAC_ID - Input: String of MAC ID. The expected formats are either "11:22:33:44:55:66" or "112233445566".
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_MAC_ID, ReturnCode.MAC_LIST_FULL, ReturnCode.MAC_ADDRESS_ALREADY_EXIST, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • removeCANblueMACList

        public ReturnCode removeCANblueMACList(java.lang.String MAC_ID)
        Remove a MAC address from the MAC list. There is a bug in CANblue. It returns nothing is the MAC ID is not on the list. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        MAC_ID - Input: String of MAC ID. The expected formats are either "11:22:33:44:55:66" or "112233445566".
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_MAC_ID, ReturnCode.WRONG_MAC_ADDRESS, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • clearCANblueMACList

        public ReturnCode clearCANblueMACList()
        Clear the MAC list. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • scanCANblueMAC

        public ReturnCode scanCANblueMAC(MACScanDeviceList deviceList,
                        int time)
        Scan for any Bluetooth device. This command is not supported by CANblue (ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED). This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        deviceList - Output: The list of scanned Bluetooth devices.
        time - Input: Timeout for searching a device (1 - 255, 0 for default value of 10).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_TIME_SCAN, ReturnCode.NO_DEVICE_DETECTED, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • setCANblueConnectionSettings

        public ReturnCode setCANblueConnectionSettings(int packetType,
                                      int pagescanInterval,
                                      int pagescanWindows,
                                      byte pagescanType,
                                      long latency)
        Set the Bluetooth connection settings. This command is not supported by CANblue (ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED). This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        packetType - Input: The value of packet type (0 - 0xFFFF).
        pagescanInterval - Input: The value of pagescan interval (0 - 0x1000).
        pagescanWindows - Input: The value of pagescan window (0 - 0x100).
        pagescanType - Input: The value of pagescan type (0 or 1).
        latency - Input: The value of latency (0 - 0xFFFFFFFF).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_PACKET_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_PAGESCAN_INTERVAL_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_PAGESCAN_WINDOWS_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_PAGESCAN_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_LATENCY_VALUE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • setCANblueBaudrateBit

        public ReturnCode setCANblueBaudrateBit(byte BT0,
                               byte BT1,
                               byte busCoupling,
                               java.lang.String name)
        Manually change the Baudrate bits of the CAN controller. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:

        BT1 - Input: The value of BT1 byte.
        busCoupling - Input: ConstantList.HIGH_BUSCOUPLING or ConstantList.LOW_BUSCOUPLING.

                                  byte busCoupling)

        public ReturnCode setCANblueBaudrateAuto(int timeout,
                                byte busCoupling)

        public ReturnCode setCANblueSendCANFrames(byte mode)

      • addCANblueFilter

        public ReturnCode addCANblueFilter(byte frameFormat,
                          int messageID,
                          byte frameType)
        Add an ID to the receive filter of the CANblue. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        frameFormat - Input: The value of frame format (ConstantList.STANDARD_FRAME, or ConstantList.STANDARD_FRAME).
        messageID - Input: The value of message ID (0 - 0x7FF for Standard frame and 0 - 0x1FFFFFFF for Extended frame).
        frameType - Input: The value of frame type (ConstantList.DATA_FRAME, or ConstantList.REMOTE_FRAME).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.FAIL_ADDING_ID_TO_FILTER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

        public ReturnCode removeCANblueFilter(byte frameFormat,
                             int messageID,
                             byte frameType)
        Remove an ID from the receive filter of the CANblue. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.

                          boolean enableFilter)

      • PutCANblueASCIIMessage

        public ReturnCode PutCANblueASCIIMessage(MessageStructure message)
        Transmit a message (in ASCII format) to the CANblue controller. This method works together with the transmit thread by not sending every message directly. The transmit mechanism will be activated every 5ms or if there are enough data inside the buffer before 5ms. This mechanism increases the data rate and decrease time needed to send messages. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_LENGTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_ACQUIRE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_RELEASE, ReturnCode.WAITING_TO_SEND_TIMEOUT, or ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD.

      • PutCANblueBinaryMessage

        public ReturnCode PutCANblueBinaryMessage(MessageStructure message)
        Transmit a message (in Binary format) to the CANblue controller. This method works together with the transmit thread by not sending every message directly. The transmit mechanism will be activated every 5ms or if there are enough data inside the buffer before 5ms. This mechanism increases the data rate and decrease time needed to send messages. The binary format is shorter than the ASCII format, so it takes less time and increase data rate. This method is used by the API_ADK, but should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_LENGTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_ACQUIRE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_RELEASE, ReturnCode.WAITING_TO_SEND_TIMEOUT, or ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD.

      • transmitCANblueMessage

        public ReturnCode transmitCANblueMessage(MessageStructure message)
        Transmit a single message (in ASCII format) to the CANblue controller. This method is not used by the API_ADK.
        Parameters:
        message - Input: Message to be sent.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_LENGTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.MESSAGE_TOO_LONG, or ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH.

      • createCANControllerObject

        public Driver.CANDevice.CANController createCANControllerObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Constructor of the CANController class.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of Driver.intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        Driver.CANDevice.CANController object or null if it is already created.

      • createCANMessageObject

        public Driver.CANDevice.CANMessage createCANMessageObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Constructor of the CANMessage class. The limitation of the object creation is 1 if the Hardware filter is used, and 128 if the Software filter is used. The controller should be stopped before creating MessageChannel object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of Driver.intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        Driver.CANDevice.CANMessage object or null if the input is wrong or the number of the object is more than the limitation.
